Posted December 18, 2011 12:58 am - Updated December 18, 2011 12:48 am
From staff reports

Boil water notice

The City of St. Augustine’s Department of Public Works has issued a precautionary boil water notice after a water main break on U.S. 1 Saturday morning.

The break caused water outage and low pressure to Northtowne Plaza at 3551 N. Ponce De Leon Blvd. Public Works advised that customers in the area should boil all water used for drinking, cooking, making ice, brushing teeth or washing dishes until further notice.

The precautionary boil water notice will remain in effect until a bacteriological survey shows that the water is safe to drink.

For more information, contact the Public Works Department at 825-1040 or 825-1044 after normal business hours.

Hinds County boil water notice lifted

HINDS COUNTY, MS (Mississippi News Now) -

State officials lifted several precautionary boil water alerts Saturday that covered areas in Hinds County.

Customers who get their drinking water from the North Hinds Water Association number 2, Chapel Hill and the North Hinds Water Association number 6 Shepherd Hill. The water is now safe to drink. Also customers that get their drinking water from the Hinds County Detention Center Water System, Thomasville Water Association, and the Thomasville Water Association number 2 have also been cleared.

Tests performed by the State Department of Public Health Laboratory have determined the water safe to drink.

Boil Water Advisory Lifted For Areas In Richlands

Posted: Sat 4:27 PM, Dec 17, 2011 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Tue 9:22 AM, Dec 20, 2011

Residents in one part of the East can begin drinking tap water again. A boil water advisory for some areas in Richlands in Onslow County has been lifted.

Crews worked to repair a leak on the water main at the intersection of Franck Street and Academy Drive.

The advisory went into effect Saturday and was purely precautionary.


Previous Story

A boil water advisory is in effect for some areas in Richlands in Onslow County.

Crews are working to repair a leak on the water main at the intersection of Franck Street and Academy Drive.

Due to the location of this leak, the outage will affect residents and businesses on Academy Drive, Foy Street, Wilmington Street, Church Street, Hargett Street, Franck Street, and on Hwy 258 from Sylvester Street to Fay Avenue including all of Sylvester Heights are asked to boil their water.

Officials say the advisory is a precaution. There is no indication of any contamination, and ONWASA will notify residents when laboratory testing confirms that the water system is operating normally.

            var lastUrlComponent = urlPath.match(urlPathReg)[1];

            var pageLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.pagelevel');
            var sourceLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.sourcelevel');
            var isArticle = new RegExp(/.html$/).test(urlPath);
            if ( lastUrlComponent === 'video' ) {
                pageLevel = 'videofront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent === 'galleries' ) {
                pageLevel = 'galleryfront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent.match(classifiedSearchReg) ) {
                pageLevel = pageLevel + '.' + sourceLevel;
            } else if (urlPath.search("/weather/") !== -1  && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'sectfront.weather';

                pageLevel = 'sectfront.latestnews';
            } else if (urlPath.search("-columns-blogs/") !== -1 && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'blogfront';

<span id="pubilsh_date">
                        December 16, 2011 08:40 PM
                    </span>

<p class="published-date">

<div class="dateline-storybody">
<div class="clearfix" id="story-target">
<div class="content-body" id="content-body-">
<p>Drinking  water in Burton was declared safe Thursday evening, several hours after  officials at the Beaufort-Jasper Water & Sewer Authority and the  S.C. Department of Health and Environmental Control asked residents to  boil water as a precaution. </p>
<p> The precautionary boil was called  for after water pressure dropped while water service was being restored  on Burton Wells Road, according to a news release. Tests showed no  bacteria entered the system.</p>
<p> The boil was in effect for all  subdivisions along Joe Frazier Road, Mroz Road (including Irongate,  Capehart and Pelican Circle) and Morrall Drive and the Habersham  subdivision, according to the release.</p>

            }, false );

<h2 class="heading link">

<!--Needs to be on the DOM on page load for IE. Needs to be visible to set the correct height of the comment component. I'm hiding it on document ready. Appending it later did not work-->
<div class="fb-comments in" data-href="" data-numposts="10" data-width="100%" id="fb-comments"></div>
<script>
(function(){
  var $commentingContainer = $('#commenting-container'),
      $commentContainerChevron = $commentingContainer.find(".glyphicon-chevron-down"),
      $fbComments = $("#fb-comments");
      
    if($("meta[property='fb:app_id']").length === 1 && $("meta[name='allow-comments']").prop("content") === "true") {
         
      $commentingContainer.on('click', 'a.comments-toggle', function(){
        if (typeof mi.commenting === "undefined") {
            mi.commenting = new mi.Commenting();
            mi.commenting.setConf( {
                accountName: mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.domain'),
                fbapp_id: mi.pageInfo.getConf('facebook.app.id'),
                fb_comment_div: {'data-width': '100%'}
            });
            mi.commenting.display();
            FB.XFBML.parse(document.getElementById("fb-comments"));
        }
        
        toggleComments();
      });
      
      $(document).ready(function(){
        toggleComments();
      });
      
    } else {
      
        var disabledText = 'Comments have been disabled for this story.';
        $fbComments.prepend("<p><strong>" + disabledText + "</strong></p>");
        
    }
    
    //toggleClass() wasn't working in IE the first time if it has the class
    function toggleComments(){
      if ($fbComments.hasClass('in')) {
          $fbComments.removeClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.removeClass("rotate");
      }else {
          $fbComments.addClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.addClass("rotate");
      }
    }
})();
</script>

</div>

        credit_read_story: function() {
            this.post_to_nextbee("");

            this.post_to_nextbee("");
        },

        },

        initialize: function() {
            this.user_cookie = checkUserSubscribed('MPPUser');
            if (this.user_cookie) {
                var cookie_json = JSON.parse(this.user_cookie);
                if (cookie_json) {
                    this.user_email = cookie_json.NextBeeEmail;

            return this.user_cookie && this.user_email &&
                   this.nextbee_host && this.nextbee_client && this.nextbee_campaign &&
                   widget_id;
        },

        post_to_nextbee: function (widget_id, href) {
            if (this.required_values_present(widget_id)) {
                var nextbee_url = ['https://' + this.nextbee_host, 'nextbeeapis',
                    this.nextbee_client, this.nextbee_campaign, 'Event'].join('/') +

                    'ts-key': timestamp_key,
                    'api-call-signature': api_call_signature,
                    'cache-control': 'no-cache',
                    'content-type': 'application/json',
                    },
                    complete: function(data) {
                        if(href)
                        {

                        }

                    }
                } );
            }
        }
    };

    $(function(){

</script>

                        December 15, 2011 08:17 PM

<div class="dateline-storybody">
<div class="clearfix" id="story-target">
<div class="content-body" id="content-body-">
<p>Burton-area  residents are advised to boil tap water before using it, according to a  Thursday news release from the Beaufort-Jasper Water & Sewer  Authority.</p>
<p>The advisory area includes all subdivisions along Joe  Frazier Road; Mroz Road, including Irongate, Capehart and Pelican  Circle; and Morrall Drive. It also includes the Habersham subdivision.</p>
<p>Residents  and businesses in the affected area are urged to use boiled or bottled  water for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, preparing food and  giving to pets until further notice. The water is safe for bathing and  laundry, the release said. </p>
<p>The advisory is the result of water  pressure dramatically dropping Thursday while service was being restored  to the area along Burton Wells Road. The S.C. Department of Health and  Environmental Control requires that water utilities issue a  water-boiling advisory as a precaution when such an event occurs because  bacteria could enter the water system. </p>

<div class="fb-comments in" data-href="" data-numposts="10" data-width="100%" id="fb-comments"></div>
<script>
(function(){
  var $commentingContainer = $('#commenting-container'),
      $commentContainerChevron = $commentingContainer.find(".glyphicon-chevron-down"),
      $fbComments = $("#fb-comments");
      
    if($("meta[property='fb:app_id']").length === 1 && $("meta[name='allow-comments']").prop("content") === "true") {
         
      $commentingContainer.on('click', 'a.comments-toggle', function(){
        if (typeof mi.commenting === "undefined") {
            mi.commenting = new mi.Commenting();
            mi.commenting.setConf( {
                accountName: mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.domain'),
                fbapp_id: mi.pageInfo.getConf('facebook.app.id'),
                fb_comment_div: {'data-width': '100%'}
            });
            mi.commenting.display();
            FB.XFBML.parse(document.getElementById("fb-comments"));
        }
        
        toggleComments();
      });
      
      $(document).ready(function(){
        toggleComments();
      });
      
    } else {
      
        var disabledText = 'Comments have been disabled for this story.';
        $fbComments.prepend("<p><strong>" + disabledText + "</strong></p>");
        
    }
    
    //toggleClass() wasn't working in IE the first time if it has the class
    function toggleComments(){
      if ($fbComments.hasClass('in')) {
          $fbComments.removeClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.removeClass("rotate");
      }else {
          $fbComments.addClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.addClass("rotate");
      }
    }
})();
</script>

<div class="modal-body">
<p>We've got you covered if you're looking for box scores and other late sports results that missed the printed newspaper because of early deadlines.</p><p>Our <strong>Sports Extra</strong> pages are formatted like traditional printed sports results, and are available in our e-Edition print-replica newspapers.</p><p><strong>To find the Sports Extra:</strong> Open either <a href="http://digital.olivesoftware.com/Olive/ODN/IslandPacket/default.aspx">The Island Packet</a> or <a href="http://digital.olivesoftware.com/Olive/ODN/BeaufortGazette/default.aspx">The Beaufort Gazette</a> e-Edition (free to print and digital subscribers) and look for the Sports Extra icon (<img src="http://media.islandpacket.com/static/images/icons/sports-extra.jpg" style="width: 30px; vertical-align:middle"/>) in the top menu.</p><p>If you're using an iPhone or other smartphone, or an iPad in portrait view, you'll find the Sports Extra pages in the menu at the upper right (look for the <img src="http://media.islandpacket.com/static/images/icons/hamburger.jpg" style="width: 20px; vertical-align:middle"/> symbol).</p>

            this.user_cookie = checkUserSubscribed('MPPUser');
            if (this.user_cookie) {
                var cookie_json = JSON.parse(this.user_cookie);
                if (cookie_json) {
                    this.user_email = cookie_json.NextBeeEmail;

                   widget_id;
        },

        post_to_nextbee: function (widget_id, href) {

                var nextbee_url = ['https://' + this.nextbee_host, 'nextbeeapis',

                    'api-call-signature': api_call_signature,
                    'cache-control': 'no-cache',
                    'content-type': 'application/json',

                    }
                } );
            }
        }
    };

    });

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p><strong>Press release submitted by Randy Parker</strong></p><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/qconline.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>Boil order for residents to Silvis Heights Water that live south of 13th Avenue and west of 19th Street in East Moline in the 35th thru 39th Avenue area has been lifted.</p>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/qconline.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<p></p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

<script>
                        // Hide reactions with no votes
                        $(".reaction-count").each(function() {
                            var value = $(this).text();
                            if (value == 0)
                                $(this).css('display', 'none');
                        });
                    
                        // Hide reaction message
                        $('#reaction-form-message').hide();
                    
                        // Adjust message height
                        $(document).ready(function() {
                            var formHeight = $("#reaction-form-wrapper form").height();
                            $("#reaction-form-message").css('height', formHeight + 2);
                        });
                    
                        // Dynamically adjust width
                        $(document).ready(function() {
                             
                               var shareWidth = $(".asset-body").width();
                               $("#reaction-form-wrapper form").css('width', shareWidth);
                             
                            
                            $("#logged-in-reminder").css('width', shareWidth);
                            $("#reaction-form-message").css('width', shareWidth);
                        });
                        
                        // Adjust on window resize
                        jQuery(window).resize(function () {
                             
                            var shareWidth = $(".asset-body").width();
                            $("#reaction-form-wrapper form").css('width', shareWidth);
                             
                            $("#logged-in-reminder").css('width', shareWidth);
                            $("#reaction-form-message").css('width', shareWidth);
                        });
                        
                        // Click actions
                        var emotion = ["angry", "sad", "funny", "wow", "love"];
                        $.each(emotion, function(i) {
                            $('.' + this).click(function() {
                                var thisReaction = localStorage.getItem('selectedolditemClass-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377');
                                var thisReactionId = localStorage.getItem('selectedolditem-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377');
                                if (thisReaction === emotion[i] && thisReactionId === 'd34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377') {
                                    $(this).off('click');
                                } else if (thisReaction != null && thisReactionId === 'd34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377') {
                                
                                    // Remove previous vote in form
                                    $("input#action").val('remove');
                                    $("input#hidden-type").val(thisReaction);
                                    $('form#reaction-form').submit();
                    
                                    // Remove background color of old vote
                                    $('.form-icons.' + thisReaction).css('background-color', '');
                    
                                    // Remove count 
                                    var counter = parseInt($.trim($("#reaction-" + thisReaction + "-count").html()));
                                    var counterK = parseInt($.trim($("span." + thisReaction + "-over-k").html()));
                                    $("#reaction-" + thisReaction + "-count").html(--counter);
                                    $("span." + thisReaction + "-over-k").html(--counterK);
                                    $(".reaction-count").each(function() {
                                        var value = $(this).text();
                                        if (value == 0)
                                            $(this).css('display', 'none');
                                    });
                    
                                    // Remove storage items
                                    localStorage.removeItem('selectedolditem-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('selectedolditemClass-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('increaseCounter-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('key');
                    
                                    // Add the new vote
                                    $("input#action").val('add');
                                    $("input#hidden-type").val(emotion[i]);
                                    $('.' + emotion[i] + '-icon reaction-name').hide();
                                    $('#reaction-form-message p').text("You reacted: " + emotion[i] + "!");
                                    $('#reaction-form-message').show().delay(1000).fadeOut("slow");
                                    $('#reaction-' + emotion[i] + '-count').css("display", "block");
                                    $('.form-icons.' + emotion[i]).css('background-color', 'rgba(0,0,0,.1)');
                                    $('form#reaction-form').submit();
                                    var id = 'd34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377';
                                    var classStorage = emotion[i];
                                    localStorage.setItem("selectedolditem-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377", id);
                                    localStorage.setItem("selectedolditemClass-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377", classStorage);
                    
                                    // Add a count to the vote
                                    var counter = parseInt($.trim($("#reaction-" + emotion[i] + "-count").html()));
                                    var counterK = parseInt($.trim($("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k").html()));
                                    var counterKlabel = $("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k");
                                    var labelCounter = parseInt($.trim($("#reaction-" + emotion[i] + "-count").html()));
                                    var counterIncrease = $("#reaction-" + emotion[i] + "-count").html(++counter);
                                    var mainNumberK = $("." + emotion[i] + " #over-k-count");
                                    var counterK = parseInt($.trim($("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k").html()));
                                    var labelCounterIncrease = $(emotion[i] + "-icon.add-count").html(++counter);
                                    var object = new Date().getTime();
                                    $(counterKlabel).html(++counterK);
                                    localStorage.setItem("increaseCounter-d34b58fc-891d-5505-81ea-b0017247e377", counterIncrease);

<div id="WNStoryHeader">
<h3 class="">San Augustine will continue to distribute drinking water Monday, Jan. 2nd</h3>
<style>time.prefixdate:before{content:'Posted: ';}time.prefixdate:before{content:'Updated: ';}</style><div class="debug hide" data-debug="Display Size 37 attempting to load..."></div></div><!--END WNStoryHeader-->
<div class="wnRight" id="WNStoryRelatedBox" wncollapse="true"><div class="debug hide" data-debug="Display Size 20 attempting to load..."></div><div class="wnStoryBodyGraphic wnImageWidth-180"><img alt="" border="0" src="http://ktre.images.worldnow.com/images/16426757_BG1.jpg" title="" width="180"/>
</div><div class="wnStoryBodyGraphic wnImageWidth-180"><img alt="" border="0" src="http://ktre.images.worldnow.com/images/16426757_BG2.jpg" title="" width="180"/>
</div></div>
<script type="text/javascript">if (Worldnow.EventMan) Worldnow.EventMan.event('WNStoryRelatedBoxdone');</script>
<!--END WNStoryRelatedBox-->
<div class=" withRelated right" id="WNStoryBody"><span id="WNStoryDateline">SAN AUGUSTINE COUNTY, TX (KTRE) -
            </span><p>The City and County of San Augustine will continue water distribution to the customers served by the City of San Augustine Water; which includes, San Augustine Rural Water and Bland Lake Rural Water.   </p>
<p>Water will be distributed Monday, January 2nd from noon until 5 p.m. at the San Augustine County Rodeo Arena / Expo Center. </p>
<p>The county is still under a boil water notice. This means everyone should bring water to a rolling boil for <strong>three minutes</strong>. <br/></p>
<p>Allow the water to cool before using</p>
<p><strong>Store cooled water, boiled water or bottled water for:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Drinking</li>
<li>Brushing      teeth</li>
<li>Preparing      food and baby formula </li>
<li>Making      ice</li>
<li>Pets</li>
</ul>
<p> </p>
<p>Even though City of San Augustine water is not approved for drinking unless boiled, it has been treated and it is approved for bathing and washing clothes.</p>
<p>This advisory is in effect until the San Augustine Water System and County are confident there is no longer a public health concern.  We will provide the next update as soon as the permanent repair has been made and TCEQ has tested and approved the water for consumption.</p>
<p> </p></div><!--END WNStoryBody-->

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/new-york/halfhollowhills/around-town">community corner</a> <h1>
      BREAKING: Dix Hills Boil Water Notice Lifted    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">County rescinds directive after 21 samples taken yesterday produce negative results.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/amanda-lindner">Amanda Lindner, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-01-01 18:52:35">Jan 1, 2012 6:52 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2012-01-01 18:59:03">Jan 1, 2012 6:59 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/3134316/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/new-york/halfhollowhills/breaking-boil-water-notice-lifted" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->
</div>
</header> <!-- /#page-header -->
<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>

data-disqus-identifier="3134316">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="BREAKING: Dix Hills Boil Water Notice Lifted" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/592440/2012/01/T800x600/cc87c0c9e0ceb6435385af0c865c9d7.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>Residents in the Dix Hills Water District no longer have to boil their the water before consumption after 21 samples taken Saturday all tested negative for coliform bacteria.</p> <p>The Suffolk County Department of Health Services today lifted the boil water notice and declared that it is safe to drink from the tap.</p> <p>Samples taken last week on Dec. 27 and 28 detected total coliform bacteria in the distribution system, officials of the Dix Hills Water District began chlorination. The district hand-delivered notices to its 8,000 customers informing them of the results and giving information about coliform bacteria in water and instructions about boiling water.</p> <p>Subsequent testing, beginning after the Dec. 28 test and before chlorination started, and all tests since have proven negative for coliform bacteria.</p> <p>The Dix Hills Water District, its consulting engineer and its state-approved laboratory are investigating what caused the bacteria to appear. The Suffolk County Department of Health Services is also investigating the source of the contamination in the samples. The District is continuing the chlorination.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Boil order lifted for Cross Co.

CROSS COUNTY, AR (KAIT) - The Cross County Rural Water System has announced that the boil water notice has been lifted.

The affected portion of their service was only for customers east of Wynne and also along Highway 64 B.

<header>
<strong class="breadcrumb"><a href="/long-island">Long Island</a><a href="/long-island/nassau">Nassau</a></strong>
<h1>Boil water notice issued in Dix Hills</h1>
</header>
</div>
<div class="gut">
<section class="contentWell">
<div class="byline">
<div>
<strong>By ZACHARY R. DOWDY</strong>         	 <a href="mailto:zachary.dowdy@newsday.com?subject=newsday.com">zachary.dowdy@newsday.com</a> <time datetime="2011-12-30T19:57:00-05:00" itemprop="datePublished">Updated December 30, 2011 7:57 PM</time>
</div>
</div>
<div class="sshare">
<a class="printBtn" onclick="window.print();"> Print</a>
<a class="commentBtn " href="#"> See Comments</a>
<input id="checkbox_toggle" type="checkbox"/>
<label for="checkbox_toggle">
<a class="tog">Share <i class="fa fa-share-alt"></i></a>
</label>
<div class="simpleShare">
<a class="fb" href=""><i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-facebook"></i>Share</a>
<a class="tw" data-mention="@Newsday" href=""><i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-twitter"></i> Tweet</a>
<a class="gp" href=""><i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-google-plus"></i> Share</a>
<a class="env" href=""><i aria-hidden="true" class="fa fa-envelope"></i> Email</a>
</div>
</div>
<p>	Dix Hills Water District authorities are chlorinating the water supply and urging residents to boil drinking water after coliform bacteria turned up in two samples this week.</p>
<p>	The samples were taken Tuesday and Wednesday during routine tests, but no subsequent tests have yielded the bacteria, said Huntington Town spokesman A.J. Carter.</p>
<p>	"These measures are being taken to preserve the health and safety of Dix Hills Water District customers," he said.</p>
<p>	The district, with about 8,000 customers, has a "long history of good water," Carter said.</p>
<div class="teadsAd"></div>
<p>	District customers began receiving notices of the boil water notice in the mail Friday.</p>
<p>	Officials advise residents to also boil water used in preparing food, making baby formula, washing dishes, making ice or brushing teeth.</p>
<p>	In 2007, some bacteria were detected in district water and officials began chlorinating. That program was discontinued in 2009 when tests showed it was no longer necessary.</p>
<div class="byline bot">
<div>
<strong>By ZACHARY R. DOWDY</strong>         	 <a href="mailto:zachary.dowdy@newsday.com?subject=newsday.com">zachary.dowdy@newsday.com</a> </div>
</div>

Goessel advised to boil water

The Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE) issued a boil water advisory Tuesday for the city of Goessel.

A leak in the city’s main water line caused the water system to lose pressure. When such a loss of pressure occurs, it is possible for contaminants to enter the system, and chlorine residuals may drop to levels that are inadequate.

Public works employee Matt Voth discovered the leak on Marion Avenue near the water tower and summoned repair crews.

Anyone served by the affected public water system should observe the following precautions:

  • Boil water vigorously for one minute prior to use. Boiling longer than three minutes may adversely affect the quality and taste of the water.
  • Use only boiled water for drinking, diluting fruit juices, and all other food preparation.
  • Dispose of ice cubes and do not use ice from a household automatic icemaker. Remake ice cubes with water that has been boiled.
  • Disinfect dishes and other food contact surfaces by immersion for at least one minute in clean tap water that contains one teaspoon of unscented household bleach per gallon of water.

5. Water used for bathing does not generally need to be boiled. Supervision of children is necessary while bathing or using water for any reason so contaminated water is not accidentally ingested. Persons with cuts or severe rashes may wish to consult their physicians.

The boil water advisory will remain in effect until testing of water samples indicates no evidence of contamination.

Goessel City Clerk Anita Goertzen said water samples will be hand delivered to the Continental Analytical Lab in Salina for testing once the leak is fixed.

Last modified Dec. 28, 2011

Boil water when preparing formula

Wednesday, December 28, 2011
By Lindsay Reed

Barry County Health Department Administrator Roger Brock warns parents to boil all water before mixing baby formula.

"Make sure and boil water for two minutes, and then, let it cool before mixing it with the powder," said Brock. "Mixing powdered formula with cold water leaves the potential for something to happen."

Brock said parents should even boil bottled water purchased at retail stores to ensure contaminates are eliminated.

"The bacteria they are looking for is called sakazakill," said Brock. "It is very rare."

Brock said currently only two cases of the bacteria have been reported. None of the cases have been in Barry County.

"There has been no recall notice issued yet," said Brock. "We have received a health alert from the state, and we are currently fielding questions.

"No formula formerly offered by the WIC program has been included in the investigation," said Brock. "I know that at a store in Lebanon the formula has been from shelves, but we don't think there have been any of that formula seen in this area."

Preliminary tests have indicated that a newborn boy in Lebanon died from the rare bacterial infection Cronobacter sakazakill. The newborn was fed Enfamil Newborn formula before he died.

The lot number associated with the formula that is currently under investigation is ZP1K7G. Water used to mix the formula is also being tested for the bacteria.

"They are currently still testing the formula," said Brock. "They are not sure if the bacteria came from the formula or not. They are trying to pin that down and will release more information once testing is complete.

"It's kind of a rare situation," said Brock. "We are hoping these are isolated cases and no more pop up."

Brock said that the health department is warning parents to not leave bottles sitting out for long periods of time.

"Mixed formula should be refrigerated and used in the proper amount of time," said Brock. "Parents should follow all temperature control directions on formula packaging.

"It is also recommended that parents dispose of left over mixed formula and follow other general food safety rules," said Brock.

Home→Collections→Lee Feldman

Main break on Christmas Eve makes blood pressure rise, water pressure drop

Service restored, but precautionary boil-water notice remains in effect

December 25, 2011|By MikeClary">Mike Clary, Sun Sentinel

A precautionary boil water order remained in effect at least until noon Monday for more than 200,000 Broward County residents who were without water for more than three hours on Christmas Eve after a major break in an underground pipe.

The rupture of a 42-inch water main beneath Northeast 38th Street sent a manhole cover into the air, produced a geyser of water 12 feet high, and raised the blood pressure of many in seven local communities as their water pressure dropped to zero just after 8 p.m. Saturday.

An investigation into the cause of the break would not be determined until Tuesday, according to Fort Lauderdale city manager Lee Feldman.

Also to be examined were delays in putting out automated "code red" telephone calls to utility customers, and an inability to remotely update the city's website over the holiday weekend, said Feldman.

"Overall, it went very well," said Feldman. "But we need to go from very well to excellent."

The break in the main cut off water to residents of Fort Lauderdale as well as to customers in Lauderdale-by-the-Sea, Oakland Park, Port Everglades Authority, Village of Sea Ranch Lakes, Wilton Manors and sections of Davie and Tamarac.

Those are the areas affected by the boil-water order.

Water was restored about 11 p.m. Saturday, about two hours after the city's automated phone system advised customers to boil tap water used for drinking or cooking until further notice.

The advisory includes using boiled or bottled water for brushing teeth but not washing or bathing.

The Christmas Eve emergency began minutes before Fort Lauderdale Mayor Jack Seiler's cellphone buzzed at 8:11 p.m. with a text message from a neighbor. "Merry Christmas, Mayor. We have no water."

Seiler said that when he pushed away from the dinner table and arrived at the scene minutes later, a 12-foot geyser of water was flooding Northeast 38th Street between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.

"It is a pretty significant leak that will require a pretty good size repair job," said Seiler.

Hope Gold, 51, said she was just about to step into the shower before heading to church when the water became a trickle.

"I tried calling the public works number, but it was busy," said Gold, a paralegal who lives in Oakland Park. "So I figured I wasn't the only one."

Kristi Bothe, 36, of Fort Lauderdale, said she had just returned from a trip and was about to put a load of dirty clothes in the washer when the spigots went dry.

"My biggest problem was the alert didn't go out, there was no recorded message and there was nothing on the website," she said.

Feldman said that within a hour of the break, 10 telephone operators were called in to work. By 9:30 p.m., the first of the automated phone calls went out to customers, he said.

However, problems with the phone system, and the volume of water utility customers to be called, meant that some residents did not receive calls until 11 p.m. or later. Feldman said an automated system used by the city's police was also employed to speed the process.

Feldman and Seiler both praised the response of the city public works crews, and city officials from other cities who buy water from the utility.

Within minutes of the break in the pipe, city police, Broward Sheriff Office deputies and fire-rescue crews were in the intersection, along with water department experts.

Once the problem was diagnosed, crews under the supervision of public works director Albert Carbon closed off a series of four valves that diverted the water around the ruptured main. "After that, the pressure at the plant came back up quickly," said Feldman.

"This was an unfortunate incident," said Feldman, who was celebrating his daughter's 14th birthday at a downtown restaurant when he learned of the break and got a lift to the scene in a police car. "The timing was not the best, but we handled it the way we should have."

Staff writer Cara Fitzpatrick contributed to this report.

mwclary@tribune.com or at 954-356-4465

Boil water order issued for parts of Rusk County has been lifted

From Staff Reports
Dec. 20, 2011 at 5:26 a.m.


A boil water order for parts of Rusk County has been lifted.

South Rusk County Water Supply Corp. spokeswoman Shauna Brent said this morning that samples returned good results, and there is no longer a need to boil water.

The precautionary notice was issued Monday for Southern Rusk County residents in the Compton and McKnight area, including CR 401, CR 438 and the northern part of FM 839.
